column1: 1 ^ Benedīcam Dominum in omnī tempore; semper laus ejus in ōre meō. ^ I will bless the Lord at all times
column2: his praise shall be always in my mouth.

column1: 2 ^ In Dominō laudābitur anima mea; audiant mansuētī
column2: et laetentur. ^ In the Lord shall my soul be praised; let the meek hear
et exaltēmus nōmen ejus in idipsum. ^ O magnify the Lord with me
column3: and let us extol his name together.
et ex omnibus trībulātiōnibus meīs ēripuit mē. ^ I sought the Lord
column4: and he heard me; and he delivered me from all my troubles.

column3: et faciēs vestrae nōn confundentur. ^ Come ye to him
column5: and your faces shall not be confounded.

column3: et dē omnibus trībulātiōnibus ejus salvāvit eum. ^ This poor man cried
column5: and saved him out of all his troubles.

column1: 7 ^ Immittet angelus Dominī in circumitū timentium eum
column2: et ēripiet eōs. ^ The angel of the Lord shall encamp round about them that fear him

column1: 8 ^ Gustāte et vidēte quoniam suāvis est Dominus; beātus vir quī spērat in eō. ^ O taste and see that the Lord is sweet; blessed is the man that hopeth in him.

column2: omnēs sanctī ejus; quoniam nōn est inopia timentibus eum. ^ Fear the Lord
column3: all ye his saints; for there is no want to them that fear him.

column2: et ēsurīvērunt; inquīrentēs autem Dominum nōn minuentur omnī bonō. ^ The rich have wanted
column3: and have suffered hunger; but they that seek the Lord shall not be deprived of any good.
audīte mē; timōrem Dominī docēbō vōs. ^ Come
column5: hearken to me; I will teach you the fear of the Lord.

column1: 12 ^ Quis est homō quī volt vītam; dīligit diēs vidēre bonōs? ^ Who is the man that desireth life; who liveth to see good days?

column2: et labia tua nē loquantur dolum. ^ Keep thy tongue from evil
column3: and thy lips from speaking guile.
et persequere eam. ^ Turn away from evil
column4: and do good; seek after peace

column2: et aurēs ejus in precēs eōrum. ^ The eyes of the Lord are upon the just
column3: and his ears unto their prayers.

column1: 16 ^ Vultus autem Dominī super facientēs mala
column2: ut perdat dē terrā memoriam eōrum. ^ But the countenance of the Lord is against them that do evil things
column3: to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
et ex omnibus trībulātiōnibus eōrum līberāvit eōs. ^ The just cried
column5: and delivered them out of all their troubles.

column1: 18 ^ Jūxtā est Dominus iīs quī trībulātō sunt corde
column2: et humilēs spīritū salvābit. ^ The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a contrite heart
column3: and he will save the humble of spirit.

column2: et dē omnibus hīs līberābit eōs Dominus. ^ Many are the afflictions of the just
column3: and from them all will the Lord deliver them.

column1: 20 ^ Cūstōdit Dominus omnia ossa eōrum; ūnum ex hīs nōn conterētur. ^ The Lord keepeth all their bones; not one of them shall be broken.
21 ^ Mors peccātōrum pessima; et quī ōdērunt jūstum dēlinquent. ^ The death of the wicked is very evil; and they that hate the just shall be guilty.

column2: et nōn dēlinquent omnēs quī spērant in eō. ^ The Lord will redeem the souls of his servants
column3: and none of them that trust in him shall offend.
